title: Peel-and-Eat Shrimp With Dipping Sauces
summary: Peel-and-Eat Shrimp With Dipping Sauces is a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 12 servings. One portion of this dish contains approximately 23g of protein, 2g of fat, and a total of 123 calories. For $2.32 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of smoky rémoulade sauce, old bay seasoning, shrimp, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It works well as a reasonably priced main course. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 48%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes are Smoked Shrimp with Three Dipping Sauces, Phyllo Shrimp with Dipping Sauces, and Peel 'n' Eat Shrimp With Thai Dipping Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.

instructions: Combine 9 cups water and Old Bay seasoning in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil; add shrimp. Cover, remove from heat, and let stand 15 to 20 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink. Drain well; garnish, if desired. Serve immediately with sauces.                                                                                                Chilled Peel-and-Eat Shrimp With Dipping Sauces: Prepare recipe as directed. Place cooked shrimp in a glass bowl. Cover and chill 2 to 24 hours. Serve with sauces. Prep: 10 min., Cook: 5 min., Chill: 2 hr.

steps.step: Combine 9 cups water and Old Bay seasoning in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil; add shrimp. Cover, remove from heat, and let stand 15 to 20 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink.
Chilled Peel-and-Eat Shrimp With Dipping Sauces: Prepare recipe as directed.
Place cooked shrimp in a glass bowl. Cover and chill 2 to 24 hours.
Serve with sauces. Prep: 10 min., Cook: 5 min., Chill: 2 hr.
